definition: to order sb about/to use sb
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: Thy Lord knows best, and He has the clouds and the sun at His disposal. --Selected.
sentences.chinese: 你的主无所不知，云和太阳，都受他的使唤与调节。

sentences.english: " And "Italy is a little pervert who has become Russia's willing bitch!"
sentences.chinese: 意大利是个堕落的小贱人，心甘情愿被俄罗斯使唤。

sentences.english: The sails are not answering to our pull on the ropes.
sentences.chinese: 我们拉绳风帆不听使唤。

sentences.english: In advanced years a man's mind might go back on him at some unpredictable moment.
sentences.chinese: 上了年纪的人，脑子有时候会一下子不听使唤。

sentences.english: My body is not able to do the same things that I was able to do 10 or 15 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我的身体不再像10年或15年前那样听使唤。

sentences.english: The warden put me in the side when the king who.
sentences.chinese: 狱长便把王尊当听差在身旁使唤。

sentences.english: Most of us don’t like it when people try to boss us around.
sentences.chinese: 我们大多数人都不喜欢被别人使唤。

sentences.english: Her tongue failed her when she tried to reply.
sentences.chinese: 她想回答，但舌头却不听使唤了。

sentences.english: My dear son, nowadays, I could hardly keep my feet and walk farther.
sentences.chinese: 我亲爱的儿子，现在我的脚不听使唤，不能走远路了。

sentences.english: You 're not allowed to disappear from my world!
sentences.chinese: 难道说你的手不听使唤了。

sentences.english: Huang Chang immediately descends a bed, just ascertain the thighs have no dint, don't hear to order.
sentences.chinese: 黄裳赶忙下床，才发现双腿无力，不听使唤。

sentences.english: He wanted to chuckle, but he could not tell his mouth to do it.
sentences.chinese: 他想笑，但他的嘴不听使唤。

sentences.english: When Tom first drove his car, he was all thumbs because of his nervousness.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆第一次开车时，紧张得手脚都不听使唤了。

definition: to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to live as a parasite/doing nothing to earn one's keep
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
